title: What are lines in a poem? - Quora

response.answer_text: Honestly, lines in a poem Aren’t very easy to describe. Sometimes, they may be the Totality of one Word. Other times, they may drone on and on and on and if the writer is inexperienced, the line may have spehling errers or devolve into a run-on sentence that’s usually when the reader leaves— . Aha! I’ve solved it! Lines make up stanzas! . But what if a stanza can be one line? . But can a whole poem— . The Single Liner Yes, a poem too— -dan . So what is a line? My best answer? A line— Beneath the title Above the credits A stream of words undisturbed by the ‘enter’ key.
Lines in a poem When the words are crystal clear And your eyes fight back the tears, If you're still not feeling fine, You're gonna need another line.
